Data source parameters
Parameters of the
source
restrict (filter) the data it displays.
You can set parameters for any type of source.
In the case of working with the
SQL-based data source
, the parameters are set within the code.
When working with the
object data source
, you should specify the parameters on the tab
Filter condition
.
Let`s consider the object source of data of customer profile. You need to specify the brand of the car to analyze the data on customers who prefer the selected brand.
1. Create a data source (
more about this
).
In this case, the parameter by which the data will be filtered is included in the sources. The example considered includes the source of the
Car brand
. Be careful: the filter algorithm which containes the parameter was previously created. See more about it here
object data source
.
2. Click on the tab
Filter condition
.
3. Click
in the group
Source parameter
to create the source parameter.
4. Enter the parameter data. For this example, specify the following values.
Setting
Purpose
Name
Enter the setting name. This name is displayed when viewing the data source.
System object type
Select the object type by which the data in the source will be filtered. Let`s choose the
Car brand
for this example.
Value parameter type
Specify the type of the parameter value. The parameter type must match the value in the
System object type
field.
5. Link data source parameter with the filter algorith parameter.
6. Save the settings you made.
According to the settings, you need to select the reporting form to view the source data. After that, the source will display the corresponding data. The fields to display are specified by the
source
settings on the
Fields
tab.
